website_summaries.verdict: Flic is a clever device with plenty of uses, and its functionality is quickly growing. Today, it's a cool product. In a year, it could be one of the best smart-home purchases out there.
pros: Flic is easy to set up and even easier to use
The partnerships all work well, and the button's potential is high
cons: The iOS app isn't as sharp or deep as the Android counterpart
The Bluetooth dependency also limits Flic use to those who always carry their phone -- so the cool use cases for older folks or young children might not be possible

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle Bag to Sena Device
customer_reviews.text: Needed a way to fast forward songs on my cell phone stored in my motorcycle bag to my Sena Device and this solved the problem. Plus with two clicks I can stop the music or if I lose Bluetooth connection with my Sena10S I can restart by tapping the Flic twice without stopping the bike and opening the bag.

customer_reviews.title: How IoT should be
customer_reviews.text: Pairing takes literally 3 or 4 seconds. Bluetooth is so much easier and faster than a WiFi connection. Once paired, there is a great UI for configuring actions and a surprising amount of functionality. IFTTT, Zapier, and general web requests add almost infinite functionality on top of that. Some of the app integrations are not great. RunKeeper, for example, is not really integrated - Flic simply submits a basic time and distance log to RunKeeper, so you don't benefit from RunKeeper directly during your run. The form factor is really nice though and I have peppered my apartment with them. They're perfect for phone-free light switches and media controls.

customer_reviews.title: The only issue I had was trying to figure out how I wanted to use it...
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I had was trying to figure out how I wanted to use it. Now I have a Flic on my nightstand - 1 click turns on or off my husbands nightstand lamp, 2 clicks turns on or off my nightstand lamp and hold turns on or off our main bedroom lamp. All through IFTTT with 1 & 2 on a Pivot Power Genius outlet strip and Hold on a Wemo switch. Now if I don't want to talk to Alexa (Amazon Echo) in the middle of the night to turn on my lamp, I don't have too. Now I just need another button for my husbands night stand and one for our theater room lights.

customer_reviews.text: Not too shabby, but the flic service android application takes a huge 84 mb space, after the recent update, it came down to 54 mb. Also, the button doesn't always respond instantly, but I don't blame Flic for that, its probably the BLOATWARE that SAMSUNG keeps adding. Samsung should probably stop manufacturing smart phones. One last thing, the button is a bit too hard. An option to get a button with a softer and more responsive click would be great. However, compared to other products, this one's very discrete. I use it in my 08' bmw to switch between songs.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this but it barely controls any apps... I was under the impression it could control any function in my iPhone. I guess that's my bad for not doing better research before I bought it, but all it can do is control music playback, toggle your home button, play a sound on your phone when you can't find it & send a distress text. And I guess you have to manually re-pair it every time your phone reboots. That's pretty lame... I hope they partner with more smart device companies. I have light bulbs that run on the app Magic Home and would love to us Flic to turn them on & off but I cannot.

customer_reviews.title: Great product - Be careful when changing the backing
customer_reviews.text: The button works great. It is a simple yet intriguing product that will only get better as more applications are developed. The only reason I didn't give this five stars is because of the difficulty in removing the back panel. The Flic button comes with two back one with an adhesive backing and one with a belt-type clip. While trying to remove the backing to the button, I accidentally destroyed the button as there were no instructions (at least that I could find) on how to remove the backing. I ended up ruining the rubber coating which holds the button together.

product_meta.title: Flic: The Wireless Smart Button, Black
product_meta.description: Flic is a simple and stylish wireless button that acts as a shortcut to your favorite actions on your smartphone. With one Flic, you can call a cab, text your GPS location to your loved ones if you’re in distress, or just turn the on the lights in your smart home. Flic's simplicity brings efficiency back to the cluttered world of Phone Screens and App downloads. The wireless smart button uses BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) technology to interact with the device from a distance of up to 150 feet with an exchangeable battery. No more fiddling around with your phone, with Flic - everything is just a click away. You can set each flic to trigger three different functions; one click, double click and hold.
